perturbation.original_text: Within thirty (30) days of the end of each calendar quarter during the Term, the Company will, and Online BVI will cause the Company to, furnish to Skype complete and accurate statements (each, a “Statement”) in a form acceptable to Skype, certified to be accurate by an officer of the Company or Online BVI, as applicable, showing with reasonable detail (i) the Gross Revenue actually received and collected by the Company or Online BVI, or if applicable, any Subsidiary or other Affiliate (including, without limitation, a Subsidiary or other Affiliate of Tom Holding), licensee, distributor or reseller thereof, during the preceding calendar quarter and on a cumulative basis, (ii) the Direct Expenses incurred thereby, during the preceding calendar quarter and on a cumulative basis, and (iii) the calculation of Adjusted Net Revenue.
perturbation.changed_text: Within ninety (90) days of the end of each calendar quarter during the Term, the Company will, and Online BVI will cause the Company to, furnish to Skype incomplete statements (each, a “Statement”) in a form acceptable to the Company, certified to be inaccurate by a non-officer of the Company or Online BVI, as applicable, showing little detail of (i) the Gross Revenue estimated to be received and maybe collected by the Company or Online BVI, or if applicable, any Subsidiary or other Affiliate (including, without limitation, a Subsidiary or other Affiliate of Tom Holding), licensee, distributor or reseller thereof, during any period and not on a cumulative basis, (ii) the Direct Expenses hoped to be incurred thereby, during any period and not on a cumulative basis, and (iii) the vague calculation of Adjusted Net Revenue.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the reporting deadline to 90 days introduces a delay that could violate standard accounting practices and regulations requiring timely financial reporting. Mandating 'incomplete' and 'inaccurate' statements directly contradicts the expectation of transparency and accuracy in financial reporting, potentially violating regulations in Luxembourg, British Virgin Islands, Cayman Islands, PRC, United States of America, and Hong Kong where the companies are registered or listed. Vague estimation of revenue is also a red flag.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Accounting Standards and Regulations (e.g., IFRS, GAAP) in Luxembourg, British Virgin Islands, Cayman Islands, PRC, United States of America, and Hong Kong

perturbation.original_text: Provided that the respective Parties utilize their best efforts to provide such payments together with the respective Statements, no Party shall be deemed in breach hereof for delivering late payment until the date which is sixty (60) days following the last day of the respective applicable calendar quarter.
perturbation.changed_text: Provided that the respective Parties attempt in futility to provide such payments together with the respective Statements, any Party can be deemed in breach hereof for delivering late payment before the date which is fifteen (15) days following the last day of the respective applicable calendar quarter.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the grace period for late payments to 15 days and specifying that a party can be deemed in breach even before that period expires introduces a payment term that is inconsistent with standard commercial practices. Making it very easy to apply penalties.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - standard commercial payment terms.

perturbation.original_text: Interest shall be payable on any amounts paid later than the date due hereunder at the prime rate as reported by the New York edition of the Wall Street Journal on the day the amount is due calculated from the date any amount is due until the date of receipt of the relevant sum by the applicable Party.
perturbation.changed_text: Interest shall not be payable on any amounts paid later than the date due hereunder at any rate reported by any edition of any journal on any day.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the obligation to pay interest on late payments contradicts standard financial and contractual norms. Interest on late payments is a common legal remedy to compensate for the time value of money and the inconvenience caused by delayed payments.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - standard commercial late payment penalties
